articles.title: Coronavirus latest news: Stronger border measures may have prevented Delta variant spread, says expert - Telegraph.co.uk
articles.description: Stronger border measures could have prevented the Delta variant’s spread in the UK, a Government scientist has said, warning it will advance throughout Europe.
articles.content: Sky's Trevor Phillips, who buried his daughter last month at a Covid restricted funeral, has asked the Northern Ireland secretary why he should follow any further rules after Matt Hancock breached th… [+940 chars]

articles.author: Anna Mikhailova
articles.title: Boris Johnson 'will urge Angela Merkel to drop demands for an EU-wide quarantine for UK tourists' - Daily Mail
articles.description: Germany has been pushing to impose a European Union-wide quarantine on British tourists, including those who have been double-jabbed, arguing it would protect the bloc.
articles.content:
Boris Johnson will this week face down Angela Merkel in a bid to save summer holidays, as the German Chancellor stands accused of trying to punish the UK.

articles.title: Australia battles Delta Covid surge as Europe eases restrictions - eNCA
articles.description: Sydney's normally bustling harbourside centre was nearly deserted after its lockdown took effect, with officials bracing the public for a spiralling crisis.
articles.content:
"We do need to brace ourselves for a potentially large number of cases in the following days," said Gladys Berejiklian, the Premier of New South Wales state.

articles.title: Scientists find Neanderthal ancestor, challenging what we thought about human evolution - USA TODAY
articles.description: After studying fossils in Israel, scientists found a new kind of early human that challenges what we thought about pre-Neanderthal groups in Europe.
articles.content:
Paleontologists discovered the fossilized remains of a 98 million-year-old titanosaur in Argentina. Titanosaurs a group of large sauropod dinosaurs.
